In this verse, Musa (as) emphasizes that whatever he asks of Allah, He knows better its nature and purpose. Hopefully with Harun the spread of religion can be carried out properly, smoothly, successfully, and can paralyze various efforts of people who are misguided and misleading, can guide them to the right path.

In this verse, Allah explains that He has allowed all of Moses' requests, namely to broaden his chest, to make his affairs easier to remove the stiffness and disturbance of his tongue, to make Aaron his brother as a helper for him, so that his strength and abilities increase, working hand in hand with Aaron in carrying out his duties. So that he reads a lot of prayer beads and always remembers and remembers Allah. The six kinds of requests, as in the previous verse, are permitted by Allah for the successful implementation of this heavy and difficult mandate.

In this verse it is revealed that Allah has bestowed upon Moses several favors that were bestowed without a request, long before Moses made the above request. If God had been pleased with His generosity to give Moses many favors since his childhood without prior request, then after Moses asked for a number of things that were very necessary to expedite the path of his da'wah, towards the target he was aiming for, surely Allah would have allowed his request. Eight gifts had been given to Moses since his childhood.

This verse reminds us that when Allah was about to bestow eight kinds of gifts on Prophet Musa as, Allah gave inspiration to Musa's mother, including telling and teaching Musa's mother how to save her child from the tyranny of Pharaoh, who ordered his soldiers to kill all male babies. under his rule all were killed.

When Moses' mother was in a state of panic, she was ordered by God to put her child in a neat and strong box, then throw him into the Nile. This order was carried out by the mother of Moses immediately so that the casket fell into the hands of Pharaoh, the enemy of God and the enemy of Moses himself in the future. It is reported that one evening Pharaoh and his wife were sitting relaxed on the bank of the Nile, when suddenly he saw a chest not far from where he was. He ordered his maids to fetch the chest and bring it before him. When the chest was opened, a beautiful baby boy was seen. How happy Pharaoh's wife saw the baby. The affection and love for the baby is very deep. So he took the baby and nurtured and educated in his palace. This is the first gift. The second gift is that God has bestowed sincere affection on Moses and this love has been instilled in everyone's heart. Anyone who looks at Moses will feel affection for him. So it is not surprising that Pharaoh and his wife felt affection and love for Musa, so that his wife said to her husband, as stated in the Qur'an: And Pharaoh's wife said, "(He) is a coolness for my heart and for you. Do not kill him. , hopefully he is useful to us or we take him as a child," while they are not aware. (al-Qashash/ 28: 9) The third gift is the upbringing of Musa in the Pharaoh's palace under the supervision and observation of Allah and guarding him from everything that would disturb him, when he was raised by the family of the cruel human Pharaoh who did not know humanity.

When Moses was under the care of Pharaoh's family, they were busy looking for women who would suckle him. Every woman who had been appointed to suckle him, Moses would not suckle him. This is a hint from Allah: And We prevented him (Moses) from breastfeeding women who wanted to breastfeed (him) before that. (al-Qashash/28: 12) Before they found the woman that Musa wanted to breastfeed him, Maryam, Musa's sister, was told by her mother to follow her sister's coffin secretly and offer the Pharaoh's family a woman who would breastfeed Musa and raise him as told in in the word of Allah: "Shall I show you, a family that will take care of him for you and they can be good to him?" (al-Qashash/28: 12) Maryam's offer was well received by Pharaoh's family, so her mother, namely Musa's own mother, was brought in, and Musa followed her to her mother. Thus, Musa was brought back to the care of his own mother and his mother's worries and sorrows disappeared. In fact, how happy she was to see her child safe, fresh and fit. This is the fourth gift. The fifth gift, namely when Moses entered the land of Manuf, the land of Pharaoh, during the day which was quiet because the inhabitants were resting. He saw two people fighting, one from the Children of Israel, namely his group, and the other from the Kibti nation from the Pharaoh's group, in fact he was Pharaoh's cook. When the Children of Israel asked for help, Musa then punched the enemy of the Children of Israel. Unexpectedly, as a result of Musa's fist, the Kibti died. Upon this accidental incident, Musa felt anxious and afraid, as told in the word of God: Because of that, he (Moses) became afraid to be in the city while waiting (due to his actions). (al-Qashash/28: 18) When the incident became known to Pharaoh, he was very angry and tried to kill Musa. Pharaoh's anger and evil intentions were told to Moses by a member of the Pharaoh's group who had faith in Moses, so Musa went away to escape to the land of Midian. Thus he was saved from Pharaoh's persecution. Moses was not only saved from persecution and murder in this world, but also from the punishment in the hereafter, because the sins of people who kill accidentally have been forgiven by Allah, for his prayers, as told by Allah in His word: He (Moses) prayed, "O my Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me." So He (Allah) forgave him. Indeed, Allah, He is the Most Forgiving, the Most Merciful. (al-Qashash/28: 16) Allah gave Musa a succession of trials, to find out how far Musa's mental endurance was, as is usually the case for someone who is prepared to receive the apostles from Allah, but he could pass all of them safely, just as Musa was saved from slaughtering babies en masse by order of Pharaoh, he was saved when he was about to be killed by Pharaoh because he plucked Pharaoh's beard, Moses was defended by Pharaoh's wife on the grounds that he was still small, could not distinguish between good and bad, so Pharaoh's anger subsided and he was saved Moses from the murder of Pharaoh and other trials. This is the sixth gift. The seventh gift is the flight of Moses to Midian, where he stays for a long time, about ten years. At first, he experienced a bitter life among the people of the Madyan country, feeling the pain of living as a foreigner who needed many necessities. In the end, he was forced to become a laborer, herding his father-in-law's goats, in order to get a modest fee, to cover his needs, who was then married to Safura, the daughter of Sheikh Madyan. Thus Moses, until he reached the appointed age, neither more nor less to be made an apostle, that is, when he reached the age of forty.

The eighth gift is that Allah has chosen Musa to be an apostle, establishes evidence for the truth he has brought, leads mankind to believe in oneness of Allah and acts as an intermediary between the Creator and His creatures, conveys His true religion, which brings people to the happiness of the world and hereafter.

This verse explains that God ordered Moses and his brother Aaron to go to Pharaoh and his people with the evidence and miracles that had been shown to him, such as the change of a staff into a large, agile snake, slithering here and there, the discharge of Moses' hands from his armpits in a white state. clean shining like the sun without blemish to be used as proof and reason for the truth of his prophethood. In this verse, Allah also warns Musa and Harun that in carrying out their da'wah and conveying the message of their Lord to Pharaoh and his people, they should be serious and not negligent. Moses was ordered to explain to them that Allah sent them both to give good news of the reward that had been prepared for those who responded well to his call, and to give a painful threat to those who disobeyed and did not want to accept it.

This verse explains that Allah ordered Musa as and Harun as to go to Pharaoh to present the proofs of the truth of his prophethood bestowed by Allah, and explains Pharaoh's fallacy, because Pharaoh had gone too far in his actions beyond limits, to the extent that he claimed that he was God. He declared to his people with the words, "I am your most high god." This verse specializes in preaching and appealing to Pharaoh, while in the previous verse, preaching is called upon to the public, because if Pharaoh had believed in the teachings brought by the Prophet Musa (as), and Prophet Aaron, of course all Egyptians would follow him as the saying goes: 'The people follow the religion of their king. .

Allah taught Musa and Harun how to deal with Pharaoh, namely with soft words and gentle speech. Someone who is faced in this way will be impressed in his heart and will tend to welcome and accept the da'wah and invitations that are called upon him. Such a wise method has also been taught to the Prophet Muhammad by Allah, as His word: "Call (humans) to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good lessons and refute them in a good way." (an-Nahl/16: 125) On the other hand, if a person is confronted with violence and with shouts, let alone be subdued and submissive, instead he will oppose and distance himself, as explained in the word of Allah: If you had been tough and hard-hearted, they would have stay away from your surroundings. (Ali 'Imran/3: 159) In addition to Allah's instructions to Musa and his brother, so that they were polite to face Pharaoh, they were also taught the words that Musa would convey to Pharaoh, as narrated by Allah in His word: So say (to Pharaoh ), "Is there your desire to cleanse yourself (from misguidance), and I will lead you to the way of your Lord so that you will fear Him?" (an-Nazi'at/79: 18-19) It was hoped that Pharaoh would realize his error and fear the punishment that would befall him if he persisted in disobedience.

Before Musa and Harun as carried out God's command to come to Pharaoh and deliver appeals to him, they both frankly told God, that they were afraid and worried about facing Pharaoh, lest they be tortured by Pharaoh, or before delivering da'wah and explaining miracles which showed the truth of his preaching, Pharaoh had acted, issued words that were inappropriate against Allah, because he was a cruel, hard-hearted person, without the slightest humanity.

Allah consoled Musa and Harun a.s. so that they both did not need to be afraid of Pharaoh, because Allah would help him. He was the one who strengthened and protected him from the evil Pharaoh. He always heard and saw what happened between the two of them and Pharaoh, both in words and deeds. He was the one who would protect them both from the evil that Pharaoh might throw at him.

Allah ordered again that Musa and Harun a.s. went to Pharaoh and informed him that the two of them were Allah's Apostles who had been sent to him to deliver the correct message so that Pharaoh would know the positions and duties of the two of them. Before Musa and Aaron invited Pharaoh to believe in Allah, both of them asked Pharaoh, so that he would free the Children of Israel from their torture and oppression, free them from hard work, such as digging, building, lifting stones, both men and women. Pharaoh to let the Children of Israel go to Palestine. After that, Musa and Harun as explained the duties and obligations of Allah that the two of them came to explain proofs and clear evidence for the truth of their apostolate. Happiness, prosperity in this world and in the hereafter for those who obey Allah's messengers, and believe in His signs, and stay away from bad and misleading things. Such utterances were also used by the Prophet Muhammad when he sent a letter containing preaching to Heraclius king of Rome, as follows: "In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. From Muhammad the servant and messenger of Allah to Heraclius, ruler of the Roman country. Safety is bestowed upon those who follow the instructions. As for after that, in fact I call you to Islam. Adopt the religion of Islam so that you are safe, Allah will give you a double reward." (History of al-Bukhari and Muslim from Ibn 'Abbas)

In this verse Allah explained that it was revealed to Musa and Harun that punishment would be inflicted both in this world and in the hereafter on those who denied the preaching and call of the apostles who called to monotheism, and turned their backs and ignored the teachings and instructions of the apostles. In line with these verses, Allah says: So as for those who transgress the limits, and prioritize the life of the world, then indeed, hell is the place where they live. (an-Nazi'at/79: 37-38 and 39) And His words: So I warn you with a burning hell, which only the most wretched people enter, who deny (the truth) and turn away (from the faith). (al-Lail/92: 14-15 and 16)

It was narrated from Ibn 'Abbas that when Musa and Harun (as) arrived in front of Pharaoh's palace the two of them stood there, waiting for permission to enter. After being detained for a long time, because of very tight security, the two of them were only allowed to enter to meet Pharaoh; and a dialogue ensued between the two of them and the Pharaoh. In this verse Allah narrates the dialogue. Pharaoh asked, "If you are really the messengers of your God who sent you here, I hope you will tell me, who is your God?" In this verse, it is as if it was Moses who was asked by Pharaoh, because only Moses' name was called, even though the question was addressed to Moses and Aaron, because indeed Moses was the main one, while Aaron was only his helper.

In this verse, God explains Moses' answer to Pharaoh's question that the one who sent the two of them is God who has equipped the creatures he created with limbs according to their respective interests, such as eyes to see, ears to hear, as well as hands, feet, nose and so on. -other members of the body according to their respective functions in accordance with instructions from Allah. God's Word: And God brought you out of your mother's belly knowing nothing, and He gave you hearing, sight and conscience, that you might be grateful. (an-Nahl/16: 78) Then it is Allah who guides by giving him the function of these members to be able to distinguish between what is good and what is bad. In line with this verse. Allah's Word: For the sake of the soul and its (creation) perfection, He inspired it (way) of evil and piety, (asy-Shams/91: 7 and 8) And His words: And We have shown him two ways (virtue and evil) ). (al-Balad/90: 10)

To divert Musa from preaching to another situation, Pharaoh asked him, "O Musa, what will happen to the afterlife in the future for the people who used to be like the people of 'Ad, the Samud people who did not worship Allah, but they worshiped other than Allah. They have offerings of inanimate objects such as stones, trees, wood and others. Will they be put into heaven or will they be put into hell, tortured and punished?" Pharaoh deliberately did this so that Musa would stop presenting his arguments and other strong reasons justifying his preaching, because Pharaoh was worried that Musa's preaching would be consumed by his people, so they believed in Moses and abandoned his misguided belief that he believed that Pharaoh was Lord.

Pharaoh's question was answered by Musa (as) that the question he put forward was a question about the unseen, while the unseen, no one knows except Allah, as stated in His word: He is Allah, there is no god but Him. Who knows the unseen and the real. (al-hasyr/59: 22) He knows the unseen, but He does not show anyone about the unseen. (al-Jin/72: 26) The fate of idol worshipers, people who have worships other than Allah, is completely in Allah's knowledge, no human being knows about it. All human actions, including the fate of the people that Pharaoh asked about, have been recorded and concluded in a book, namely "Lauh Mahfudz". Nothing is left out, neither the big nor the small, except in the book, as explained in the word of Allah: What book is this, nothing is left, the small and the big but everything is recorded," and they found ( all) what they have done (written). (al-Kahf/18: 49) Based on that record they will be rewarded according to their deeds in this world. This verse closes with an affirmation that Allah will not make mistakes and will not forget , to prevent false assumptions and accusations, that the notes in the book could be wrong, misrecorded, or that there are things that were left behind which were not recorded by the authorities because they forgot, so something happened that was not in accordance with the actual reality .

In order to strengthen that Allah will not make mistakes and forget, and to reject the possibility of suspicion arising that the records in "Lauh Mahfudz" could be wrong and some were not recorded due to forgetting, this verse emphasizes that God is in control of the records, namely It is God Who made this earth a vast expanse for humans to use as a place to live, wake up, sleep and travel freely everywhere, as Allah says: Allah is the One who made the earth for you as a place to live. (al- Mu'min/40: 64) And His words: It was He who made the earth for you easy to explore, so explore in all directions. (al-Mulk/67: 15) It is God who has made roads on this earth, both in the mountains and in low places to connect one place to another, between one city and another, between one village to another, in order to facilitate carrying out human needs. In line with the word of Allah: And Allah made the earth for you as an expanse, so that you can go to and fro on broad roads. (Nuh/71: 19-20) And His words: "And We have made solid mountains on this earth so that it (does not) shake with them, and We made (also) wide roads there, so that they may be guided." (al-Anbiya'/21: 31) It is God, who sends down rainwater from the sky which causes the growth of plants and fruits of various tastes, some sour, some sweet, various kinds and types and benefits. There are things that are suitable for humans, and there are things that are good for animals, all of which show the magnitude of the gifts and the many blessings that God has bestowed on all of His servants. In line with the word of Allah: It is He who sends down water (rain) from the sky, then He produces with it (rain) fruits as sustenance for you. (al-Baqarah/2: 22)

God commanded us to eat the fruits and plants, which are of various kinds and varieties, and we give them to animals to eat. Whatever is suitable for humans to eat, such as rice, sweet potatoes, corn, sago and others, then eat according to Allah's word: And eat of what Allah has given you as a lawful and good sustenance. (al-Ma'idah/5: 88) Whichever is suitable for animals such as grass given to animals. At the end of this verse it is emphasized that all of the characteristics mentioned above show the power of Allah and the greatness of His kingdom, are clear evidence of His oneness and show that there is no God but Him. People who are reasonable and sane-minded, of course, will acknowledge and believe in the oneness of Allah.

Apart from the uses and benefits of the earth and those mentioned above, in this verse Allah explains other uses and benefits, namely that from the earth every human being was made by Allah, since the Prophet Adam was the first human being in this world. Also to the land, humans will be returned after death, and the land will return to the way it was before it was created. From that also humans will be resurrected after he dies and rearrange his limbs which have been destroyed mixed with the soil, as their original form which then returns his spirit. In line with this verse, the word of Allah: (Allah) said, "There you live, there you die, and from there (also) you will be resurrected." (al-A'raf/7: 25) In the hadith it is explained as follows: "Verily, the Messenger of Allah visited a corpse. After the corpse was buried, he took a handful of soil and then threw it into the grave while saying "minha khalaqnakum" (from it We made you), then take another one and say "fiha nu'idukum" (to him We will return you), then take another for the third time and say "minha nukhrijukum taratan ukhra" (and from it We will take you out another time) (History of Ahmad and al-hakim from Abu Umamah) In another hadith it is explained that after the body of Umm Kulsum bint Rasulullah saw was placed in his grave, Rasulullah saw said: "From it (land) We made you, and to it We will return you, and from it We have brought you out again in the name of Allah, and in the way of Allah and in the religion of the Messenger of Allah." (Ahmad and al-hakim's history from Abu Umamah)

This verse explains that Allah has shown and introduced the signs of His power and the proofs of the truth of Moses' prophethood in the form of miracles that have been given to Moses, but Pharaoh and his followers still denied and denied Moses and did not want to believe in what was conveyed to him. , even though they have essentially believed in its truth, as Allah says: "And they denied it because of their tyranny and arrogance, even though their hearts believed in (the truth) of it." (an-Naml/27: 14)

In this verse, it is explained how Pharaoh disobeyed, and how Pharaoh vilified Moses' efforts and work. Pharaoh said, "O Musa! Did you come here to the place where you once lived, after being invisible for a long time, with the intention of instilling understanding in the general public that you are a prophet, and they must follow you and believe in the religion that you bring, so that you are who was on the winning side, then drove us out of our place with your magic that you call a miracle, and you are the one who reigns as king?" Pharaoh deliberately issued such words with the intention to bring and make his people angry and hate Moses. He explained that Musa's arrival was not just to save the Israelites from their dominion, but his real intention was to drive the Egyptians out of their homeland, then to take control of all their possessions. Thus Musa's efforts failed, because no one would hear and pay attention to his preaching, regardless of the miracles he brought. They will defend their country desperately by using all the power that is in them.

This verse explains that Pharaoh promised earnestly to bring magicians to match the magic of Moses. Pharaoh asked Moses to determine a place and time to meet with his magicians, and promised that he and Moses would not violate the agreed terms. This was done by Pharaoh to show that he really had a hard heart and solid preparation to compete against Musa's magic, with the belief that he would win in the match later. Also Pharaoh suggested that Moses choose a wide area, not hilly so that the audience could watch and see the match clearly, not obstructed by anything.

This verse explains that according to Pharaoh's request, Musa determined the time of the meeting intended to complain about his miracles with Pharaoh's magic, namely on the day of Syam an-Nasim which was usually held at the end of the year. They all gathered on that day with beautiful clothes and beautiful ornaments, almost nothing was left behind. Musa also determined the time for the gathering, namely when the sun had risen, a time when the sun had already risen, so that all the spectators could watch and see the match later clearly.

In this verse Allah explains that an agreement was reached between Moses and Pharaoh regarding the place, day and time for the match to be held later, Pharaoh left the place of the debate, to arrange his deception. The sorcerers were gathered, their equipment perfected, their backers and assistants and others prepared. On the day that had been determined together, namely on the feast of Syam an-Nasim, Pharaoh and his entourage departed to the place he had agreed with Musa. He sat on his royal chair, accompanied by his top officials, flanked by his people on his left and right. Not long after that, Moses came with his staff accompanied by his brother Aaron. Pharaoh galvanized his magicians who had stood and lined up neatly in front of him, expecting them to do their job, demonstrating their skills to the best of their ability, promising to fulfill all their requests, if they won, as explained in the word of God: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "(Will) we get rewarded, if we win?" He (Pharaoh) replied, "Yes, even you must be among those who are close (to me)." (al-A'raf/7: 113 and 114)

When Moses was face to face with Pharaoh's sorcerers, Moses warned them not to follow Pharaoh's invitation, fabricate lies to Allah, say nonsense to Him, such as assuming the miracles he brought were magic, even though it was wrong. one of His greatness and power. If you take such an attitude as Pharaoh, God will torment you, consume your offspring so that no one is left, as recompense for your misguided actions. God's Word: Someday Allah will repay all that they invented. (al-An'am/6: 138) Those who invent lies against Allah are the losers. He will not be successful in his endeavors, will not reach his goals, because he is the most persecuted, as Allah says: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie against Allah, or who denies His verses? Indeed, the wrongdoers are not lucky. (al-An'am/6: 21) Therefore, wake up and be aware. Leave the act of inventing a lie to Allah. The misguided path that you are following, so that you will be safe from the punishment that will befall those who invent lies against Allah. people who have gone astray in this world, but they still think that what they do is good and right.

After the Pharaoh's magicians heard Moses' warnings and threats, they became confused, each having their own different responses. Then they held a special meeting, brainstormed what they should have done. Their conversation is kept very secret so as not to leak. That's usually how it is, a meeting is held to find tactics to beat the opponent, the conversations and decisions of the meeting must be kept secret, lest the opponent find out about it. Likewise Pharaoh's magicians, fearing that their conversation would be heard and known by Moses and Aaron, then both of them made preparations and equipment that was tough enough to deal with his magic which was difficult to defeat.

Among their undisclosed conversations that can be recorded is that if what Musa displays later is really magic, it is clear that they will defeat it. But if what he displays is a miracle from God, they may not be able to defeat him. If he beats us in the match later, what can we do, we just give up, and follow him." Finally they agreed to say that Moses and Aaron were very clever magicians, would drive us out of our country with that magic, and will strip us of this noble position. They deliberately compile a formula in such a way that contains these three factors which can result in the hatred of Moses and Aaron and the influence of both of them disappears, but common sense and sane minds, will not accept the reasons of sorcerers, people who want to violate a person's human rights by expelling him from his place of residence, as well as people who want to eliminate his position.

According to Pharaoh's sorcerers, Moses and Aaron were magicians who wanted to expel them from the land of their homeland and wanted to seize power. tactics and trickery and show all the intelligence that is owned on the day of the match later. Thus, it was easy for them to defeat the magic of Musa and his brother Aaron. How happy they would be on that day if victory would be on our side. Allah's Word: So when the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, "Are we really going to get a big reward if we win?" He (Pharaoh) replied, "Yes, and even you will certainly get a close position (to me)." (asy-Syu'ara/26: 41 and 42)

In this verse Allah explains that after Pharaoh's sorcerers felt that they had sufficient preparations, had all their supplies complete, they came to the designated match venue in neat rows. After they were confronted by Moses, they gave him choices for Moses to choose, did Moses throw the stick first? Or did the sorcerers cast it first? The action of these sorcerers is a wisdom that manifests good adab and their obedience to Musa, as if they had received inspiration from Allah. Musa after thinking for a while then chose that they should be the first to throw their staff, with the consideration that if the sorcerers had demonstrated their magic with sincerity and ability, it was then that God would show His power, by winning the right over the right. vanity, won a miracle over witchcraft and lost the magic of vanity. In accordance with the word of Allah: Actually, We throw the right (truth) to the wrong (not right) then that right destroys it, then immediately (the wrong) disappears. (al-Anbiya'/21: 18)

In this verse Allah explains that after Moses made his choice, he said to Pharaoh's sorcerers, "You were the first to start, so that we could see your magic, and know what you were actually doing. After that they threw their ropes and sticks, saying , "By the glory of Pharaoh, indeed we will win." Unexpectedly, suddenly the ropes and sticks that were thrown by them, were seen by Moses, as if he was crawling fast, it looked as if a snake was moving agile here and there

This time, Pharaoh's magicians demonstrated their special sorcery, so that Moses was afraid in his heart to see what happened. It was not only Moses who was afraid, but the spectators were afraid, because their eyes had been enchanted, with that special magic, as God said: Then after they had cast them, they cast a spell on the eyes of the people and made the people afraid, because they performed a magic that great (amazing). (al-A'raf/7: 116)
In this verse it is explained that God comforted Moses. He said to Musa, O Musa! will be defeated and will not move."

After that God ordered Moses to throw the stick that was in his right hand. Moses immediately carried out the order. By God's nature and will, Moses' staff became a huge snake and swallowed up everything Pharaoh's sorcerers made, namely the ropes and staff looked like moving snakes. In fact, what they are doing is mere fantasy and just a trick of the sorcerers, as a result of an orderly and long enough practice, it has absolutely no substance and will not last long. However, the sorcerer will not win with his deceptive magic. That is an act of sin, and will not prosper those who commit sins. As Allah says: Indeed, those who sin will not prosper. (Yunus/10: 17)

In this verse it is said that after Moses threw down the stick that was in his right hand, the stick became a big snake and swallowed up everything that Pharaoh's sorcerers did. Pharaoh's sorcerers seeing the majesty of the incident, and knowing that what Moses did, was not magic, but a miracle, not from the sorcery that they knew, nor was it a trick that they knew, and that was the truth which cannot be doubted, and no one can do such a thing, except those who have the power that if He wills something, it is enough to say, "be it," then it will be; they immediately fall down, prostrate themselves with a pledge that they have faith in the Lord of all the worlds. God of Moses and Aaron.

In this verse Allah explains that Pharaoh, after learning that his magicians had surrendered and believed in the God of Moses and Aaron, was very angry with them, because they had committed two grave mistakes. First, they recklessly believed in Moses, before they thought it through and before getting permission from him. Second, because he thought that they were Musa's students in witchcraft, they agreed to show their weaknesses, in order to make Musa's preaching stronger and acceptable to many people so that Pharaoh felt that his business was being seen as bigger and bigger. To prevent the sorcerers from being followed by the crowd, Pharaoh threatened to cut off their hands and feet crosswise, so they could no longer do anything. Also Pharaoh threatened to crucify them at the base of a date palm. Pharaoh threatened severe torture to his magicians who had believed in Moses, so that the magicians compared his torment with the torment of the God of Moses who did not cut off hands and feet by crossing each other, so that they would return to their original beliefs. and abandoned his belief in Moses, because Pharaoh thought that his magicians had faith in Moses, only because they were afraid of the painful and prolonged torment and punishment of the God of Moses.

This verse explains that Pharaoh's threat was ignored by the sorcerers who had faith in Moses, and it had no effect on them in the slightest. They will not return to adopting a misguided belief, but they will continue to believe in Moses based on clear evidence, namely the miracles they witnessed on Moses' rod that came from Allah, the Lord who created them. They will not waver and shift from their current beliefs no matter what Pharaoh will do to them. They are of the opinion that even if Pharaoh can carry out his threat only in this world, because Pharaoh can only carry out his cruelty and tyranny in this mortal world, but they prioritize and expect pleasant rewards in the hereafter, a place that is eternal and eternal.

Pharaoh's sorcerers were determined to have faith in Allah. God calls all the worlds, God who has done a lot of good to them during his life. Whatever will happen, whatever will befall them, they hope that Allah will forgive all the mistakes and sins they have committed, especially the sin of witchcraft which Pharaoh has ordered to do. This verse closes with an affirmation that Allah is the best giver of rewards to those who obey His commands, and His punishment is more painful and eternal for those who commit immorality, violate His commands, and at the same time as an answer to the words Pharaoh said, "Surely you will know which of us is more painful and more enduring in torment."

In this verse, Allah explains that whoever comes to his Lord in the hereafter will be in a state of sin, because when he was in the world he denied, did not want to believe in Allah's verses, and did a lot of immorality, abandoned Allah's commands and violated His prohibitions, he will put into hell hell. He will not die in it and continue to be tortured without end. In line with this verse, the word of Allah: And those who disbelieve, for them hell is Hell. They were not destroyed until they died, and their punishment was not relieved from them. (Fathir/35: 36) And His words: And those who are wretched (infidels) will stay away from it, (namely) those who will enter the great fire (hell), then he will not die there and not (also) live . (al-A'la/87: 11-12 and 13)

On the other hand, in this verse Allah explains that whoever comes to his Lord in the hereafter with a state of faith in Allah and in what His messenger brings such as miracles and others, and has done good deeds truly and sincerely, he will obtain a high and noble place, because of his faith and good deeds. Each person in the hereafter will receive degrees according to his deeds, as explained in the word of Allah: And each person has a rank, (according to) what they do. And your Lord is not unaware of what they do. (al-An'am/6: 132)

In this verse, Allah explains that what is meant by a high and noble place is Jannatu 'Adn, namely heaven where one resides. In heaven rivers flow, the contents of which include wine, honey, milk and water, the inhabitants of which will live forever. That is the reward for people who are clean from disbelief and disobedience. How lucky are they as Allah says: Really lucky are those who purify themselves (by faith). (al-A'la/87: 14)

In this verse Allah explains that there is no sign that Pharaoh will accept the reasons and evidence put forward to him, he is still in his arrogance and arrogance, Allah reveals to the Prophet Musa so that he will leave Egypt, the land of Pharaoh at night so that Pharaoh will not see and his army, along with the servants of Allah whom he sent to save them from the tyranny of Pharaoh. Musa and the Children of Israel left Egypt, when they arrived at the shores of the Red Sea, the Children of Israel said to Moses, "O Musa, Pharaoh and his army caught up with us from behind, in front of us a vast expanse of sea, what should we do, to cross the sea ." God commanded Moses to beat the sea with his staff. After Moses carried out this order, the sea parted to the other side. The parts of the sea are as many as the number of tribes in the Children of Israel, namely twelve and is a dry road in the middle of the sea that is not muddy and not watery. Between the halves, the water stood like a mighty mountain. Each tribe followed only one road. They can look at each other, can see one tribe to another. Musa and the Children of Israel walked their own way feeling safe, not worrying about being overtaken by Pharaoh and his army, and not feeling afraid that they would drown until they reached the other side of the sea safely as stated in the word of Allah: Then We revealed to Moses, "Strike the sea with your stick." So the sea was torn apart, and each part was like a great mountain. (asy-Syu'ara/26: 63) And His words: And We saved Musa and those who were with him. (asy-Syu'ara/26: 65)

In this verse, Allah explains that after Pharaoh learned that Musa and the Children of Israel left Egypt, he sent people to the cities to gather his troops with the intention of following Musa and his entourage. Pharaoh was so angry that he ordered his soldiers to chase Musa and his people, because they were thought to always do things that made him angry. As Allah says: Then Pharaoh sent people to the cities to gather (his army). (Pharaoh said), "Indeed they (the Children of Israel) are only a small group, and indeed they have done things that anger us. (asy-Syu'ara/26: 53-54 and 55) After that Pharaoh and his army immediately chased after Musa and his entourage. After arriving at the edge of the sea and seeing many roads stretching out before them, with no slightest suspicion they followed the paths that Musa and his entourage had passed, thinking they were normal roads. After Pharaoh with his army was in in the middle of the ocean, while Musa and his entourage had reached the other side and had landed safely, suddenly the sea waters reunited and covered Pharaoh and his army, so they all drowned. Pharaoh before drowning and when he saw a dangerous situation and it was impossible to save himself from the danger of drowning, then he realized and said the words that show that he acknowledges and believes that there is no god but Tuha n whom the Children of Israel believed in, and he was a person who submitted himself to Allah. Pharaoh's confession was useless, because he had committed a grave sin and caused corruption on earth. Pharaoh drowned but his body was saved to be a proof of Allah's power for generations to come, as Allah says: So that when Pharaoh was about to drown he said, "I believe that there is no god but God in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of those -Muslims (surrender)." Why only now (you believe), when in fact you have been disobedient long ago, and you are among those who do mischief. So today We saved your body so that you can be a lesson for those who come after you, but most people do not heed Our signs (power). (Yunus/10: 90-91 and 92)

This verse explains that Pharaoh misled his people. He thought that Musa and the Children of Israel would not be able to escape from his pursuit because the ocean stretched wide in front of him. After they reached the shore, he acted as if because of his greatness the sea was split to form roads, so he invited his soldiers to enter the streets until they all drowned. Pharaoh could not get instructions at all to avoid the danger of drowning, so he and his army perished.

This verse explains that Allah has given the Children of Israel three kinds of favors. 1. He saved them from the cruelty of their enemy, namely Pharaoh and his people. When Pharaoh inflicted the severest punishment on the Children of Israel, they slaughtered the sons and spared the daughters, and when Allah drowned Pharaoh and his army while Moses was watching. As Allah says: And (remember) when We saved you from (Pharaoh and) Pharaoh's followers. They inflicted very severe torments on you. They slaughtered your sons and spared your daughters' lives. And in that is a great trial from your Lord. And (remember) when We parted the sea for you, so that We could save you and We drowned (Pharaoh and) Pharaoh's followers, while you watched. (al-Baqarah/2: 49 and 50) 2. Musa spoke directly to his Lord on the right side of Mount Sinai and Allah sent down the Torah to him detailing clearly His Shari'a. 3. They were awarded Mann, which is food like honey, tastes very sweet, and the color is white like ice, and Salwa, which is a quail that has delicious meat, when they get lost in the vast desert. This food is available from dawn until sunrise.

In this verse Allah orders them to eat of the good sustenance, which tastes delicious and which Allah has bestowed upon them, they should never misuse it, such as spending it extravagantly, not being grateful for it, donating to disobedience, and so on. , because if so it means they have invited God's wrath that will inflict His punishment. Woe and perish to those on whom the wrath of God has fallen.

In this verse, Allah confirms that He is Most Forgiving to those who repent of shirk, cleanse themselves from sins, are sincere and their deeds are done solely for the sake of Allah, fulfill His obligations, stay away from disobedience, istiqamah in worship until he dies, and fulfill Allah's commands. , as explained in His word: And worship your Lord until sure (death) comes to you. (al-hijr/15: 99)

God gave a warning to Moses, because he quickly climbed the mountain and left his people below, even though God had ordered him to go up to the hill together with his people to receive some of the Torah in pieces and sheets. Actually, he really wanted to pray with his God to receive the pieces of the Torah. Because of that very desire, he left without inviting his people until he climbed up the hill alone. He left his people below and he ordered Aaron to watch over them as long as he was not among them. Arriving on the hill he concentrated his soul and mind waiting for what God would reveal to him as He had promised. Suddenly Allah said asking with a tone of rebuke or reproach. Why did he rush up the hill alone without taking his people with him, when he had been ordered to come with them? Indeed, God's rebuke was right for his mistake, because apart from not carrying out God's command as a whole, Moses had left his people without a leader even though there was his brother Aaron who would watch over them. It was as if Moses, because he was driven by a strong desire to do munajat with his Lord, had let go of his responsibility towards his people and no longer cared about what would happen to them while he was gone. This for a Prophet entrusted by Allah to lead and supervise his people is a negligence or neglect of his main duties which should be regretted and he deserves to receive a rebuke or reproach from his Lord.

Musa answered his Lord's warning by saying that his people were behind him and the distance between him and his people was not that far. If he takes a few steps before going up the mountain, it is not with the intention of leaving them and if they are summoned, they will definitely be able to gather with him in a short time. Indeed he rushed up this hill, because he wanted to carry out Allah's command immediately, at the time as it had been determined, that is, after he and his people had been around this hill of Tur for 40 nights. He came in a hurry because he wanted to quickly gain Allah's approval. It was because of this strong desire to please him that he became heedless and negligent of Allah's command to come with them.

In this verse it is explained that after Musa left his people to pray with his God, his people had deviated from the religion of Tawheed and had worshiped a calf statue made by Samiri. Indeed, Allah wanted to test the faith of the Prophet Musa's people, did they really have a strong and steely faith or did they still have traces of shirk or belief in worshiping idols in their hearts and souls. It turned out that their faith was not that strong and deep because only a few days after they were left by Musa and they were still under Aaron's supervision, they were easily deceived and fell into the trap of Samiri who came from the cow worshipers. But Allah will not let or accept it when people claim to have faith without being tested first according to His words: Do people think that they will be left alone by saying, "We have believed," and they will not be tested? And verily, We have tested those before them, so Allah will surely know those who are truthful and surely will know those who are lying. (al-'Ankabut/29: 2 and 3) It turned out that the people of Musa were not among those who had a strong and deep faith because they had just been abandoned by Musa for a short time (according to history, only 20 days) they had left the religion of monotheism and reverted to the religion of worshipers. - idol worshippers. This was unrepentant and probably happened because they had been under the pharaohs for so long. Because of this, their mentality is damaged and their morals are weak, so that loyalty and patience cannot be expected from them to defend a principle. So it was easy for Samiri to trick them by making a golden calf-shaped statue that could sound like a calf, so they were attracted by Samiri's words that this was the real God. As for the God of Moses and Aaron who cannot be seen, why do we want to worship him?

Hearing the word of his Lord explaining that his people had been led astray by Samiri, he quickly returned to his people in a state of great annoyance and anger. He found his people kneeling in front of a golden image of a calf, worshiping and worshiping it. They said among themselves, "This is our god and also the god of Moses. In fact, Moses had forgotten so he went to meet his Lord to the top of the hill, even though his Lord was here." It cannot be described how sad Musa's heart was when his people saw that his people could easily be led astray by Samiri and how great the anger in his heart was when he saw the atmosphere and condition of his people. According to one report, after seeing his people worshiping idols, he then heard the noise and various shouts of his people and saw them dancing around the statue. Qurtubi narrated that Abu Bakr ath-Turthusy was once asked by people about a group of people chanting the name of Allah and chanting the name of the Prophet Muhammad by dancing and beating drums and because of the fun some of them fainted, then they took the food they brought and have been prepared, what is the law of their deeds? Is this permissible in Islam or not? ath-Turthusy replied, "The Sufi School, which is like that is vanity, an ignorance and misguidance. Islam is the (teachings) of the book of Allah and the Sunnah of His Messenger. As for beating the drum (and dancing) until it is like a person who is possessed at first it was Samiri when he made a statue of a calf to be worshiped by the people of Moses by dancing around it. So such an act is the act of unbelievers and calf worshippers." Then Moses said to his people, "Why do you worship the statue when Allah has promised you good and profitable promises after giving you various favors such as freeing you from Pharaoh's people placing you in this place, giving you delicious and nutritious food. Allah promises will send down the Bible to you, in which there are laws and regulations for your good and happiness in this world and in the hereafter. He will also promise you a lot of rewards if you remain faithful and do good deeds and also promises that you will enter the holy land of Palestine by defeating its inhabitants who are strong and mighty. Why are you so quick to turn away from the religion of Allah when not long ago the promise was announced by Allah to you, and the signs of that promise will surely come true and be fulfilled as you see and experience yourself? thought that you had been waiting a long time u the fulfillment of the promise or are you deliberately waiting for Allah's wrath upon you by this deed. Haven't you promised me that you will remain faithful until I return to you, and will not concoct anything that undermines your belief or contradicts it."

His people replied, "We broke the promise not with our will and will, because we cannot control ourselves. If we were left to our own will, of course we would not do this. But Samiri has tricked us fools so that we are attracted by his words and persuasion that charmed our hearts. Samiri had forced us to carry a heavy burden consisting of jewels he lent from the Egyptians when we were about to leave Egypt. He said that a feast would be held later, because of the jewels the jewelery had to be brought and we were ordered to carry it. This was hidden from you, O Musa because he was afraid that he would be forbidden to carry it. After you died he told us to dig a big hole in the ground and light a fire to burn the jewelery, so we threw all the jewelery that we brought ."

Then Samiri took out from the hole a gold nugget in the shape of a calf and made a sound like a cow's croak. Indeed Samiri is an expert; and he was able to make a pipe in the image so that when the wind blew a calf would sound. Samiri told us that this is the god who is actually the god of all of us and also the god of Moses, he is the one we will worship and worship, it is him we ask for something when we want or need it. Samiri also said that you, O Musa, went up to the mountain to meet God even though the god that Moses was going to meet was here. Indeed, Moses was so forgetful that he struggled to find something far away, even though what he was looking for was right here.

In this verse Allah explains how stupid the people of Moses were because they could not consider something carefully whether it was bad or good, acceptable to reason or something impossible. Do they not notice that the statue is an inanimate object that can't speak and can't answer questions, let alone provide help or ward off a danger. Meanwhile, a cow that is actually animate, moves by itself, can gore and kick, can lift goods or pull a cart.

Harun once gave advice and warned them when he saw his people turning away from worshiping Allah to worshiping idols and holding worship ceremonies that were contrary to the monotheism they had adhered to so far and promised Musa that they would continue to worship Allah until he returned to them from top of the Tour hill. Harun said to them, "O my people, you have actually been tested by the statue of the calf, do you really believe and hold fast to your religion, so that nothing can be doubted by any persuasion, or is your faith only in words so that when there is something that attracts your attention or deceives you, then you leave your true religion and belief. Your God is actually God the Most Compassionate, the Most Creator, Who created all things Who proves His mercy and compassion can be seen in the universe and can be seen felt by His creatures. He has bestowed upon you physical and spiritual perfection and given you laws and regulations that guarantee your safety and happiness in this world and the hereafter. He has bestowed upon you the favor of faith and freed you from the cruelty and ferocity of Pharaoh. can be tricked and tricked by Samiri with the ema statue s in the form of a calf making sounds like a real calf? You have really deviated from the right path and have broken your promise with my brother Moses when he was going up the hill to receive the Torah scrolls as a guide from your Lord. Leave worshiping statues that cannot benefit and reject harm and return to the religion of monotheism and repent, Allah will accept your repentance and forgive your mistakes because He is Most Forgiving and Most Merciful. Follow my advice and my call so that you become servants of Allah whom He pleases.

All of Harun's advice, even though it was stated in a gentle manner and with proof and reasons that could be accepted by reason, did not get a good reception among them. They were more interested in Samiri's persuasion and deception, they said to Aaron, "We will continue to worship that statue until Musa returns to us and he will decide whether we are in error and deviation or whether the statue we worship is just Samiri's deception.

Musa was very sorry for Aaron's attitude that did not act decisively against the abuses of his people. Why does he only admonish and advise his people, even though worshiping statues is shirk that cannot be forgiven, and cannot be tolerated no matter what the reasons put forward by his people. Why didn't he follow Moses with the believers to tell him about it and take a firm stand against disobedient people. If Aaron had taken such an action, his heathen people would have been afraid and would probably have abandoned worshiping the image for fear of losing their beloved leader.

Musa again snapped at Aaron with rather harsh words, "Have you disobeyed and disobeyed my orders. I have instructed you that you take my place after me, act and prevent following the path of those who want to cause damage." The author of Al-Kasysyaf's commentary explains this as follows, "Moses was a tough person and sometimes acted harshly on matters related to the rights of Allah and religion. Because of that he could not control himself when he saw that his people had deviated from the monotheistic religion so he threw the Torah sheets he was carrying because he was shocked and amazed at the abuses of his people. He yelled at and rebuked his brother Aaron while pulling his hair and beard as if his brother was his enemy not his brother and servant."

This verse explains that Aaron, a man of calm and gentle character, did not reply to his brother's harsh and harsh words either harshly or harshly, but calmly spoke to Moses. "O son of my mother, don't tug at my beard and hair. Indeed, I did not take firm action as you wish, because if I did so, they would certainly be divided into two groups. The believer group and the disobedient group, enmity ensued and maybe a war between the two groups. If this happened, of course you would blame me too by accusing me of dividing the Children of Israel. Therefore we took a cautious stance while waiting for your return from the hill."

In this verse Allah explains that Musa rebuked Samiri with the question, "Why did you do such a disgraceful and disgraceful act of Allah that some of the Children of Israel became disbelievers after believing and worshiping idols that you deliberately made for them, you have damaged the true faith of my people and have led them astray. Do you know what the consequences of your very wrongdoing were?"

Samiri answered Musa's shouts and rebukes. I already know something that is not known by your people, so I made a statue of gold brought from Egypt in the shape of a calf and I made the statue as beautiful as possible to attract their attention. Such is my opinion and that is the best course of action in my opinion. According to some of the Mufasirin, Samiri answered Musa's shouts with strange answers that left the impression as if he had also received a revelation from God and had been in contact with Gabriel and had known him. Samiri said that he burned the gold they brought from Egypt in a hole that they made themselves. He took a handful of soil where Gabriel's footprints were, and something like a calf came out of the hole. In this way, some of the Children of Israel were attracted to Samiri's persuasion and deceit to worship the calf-shaped statue. Because the calf statue is not just any statue, but really has been sent by God to be worshiped and adored.

Musa said to Samiri, go away from here, you have no right to associate with anyone and no one is allowed to associate with you. If someone asks you about your case, you must answer "I am not allowed to approach someone and no one is allowed to approach me." This is the act of Moses who is very hard and firm against him. Where Samiri will go, there will be no place to live because around that place there is only a very wide and barren desert, not a single piece of land in the Sahara desert that can be inhabited by humans. Meanwhile wild and savage animals will find it difficult and will suffer living in that endless desert. It is narrated that Samiri after being expelled by Musa, he left that place without knowing what direction and purpose he was going to achieve. He traveled in the vast Sahara desert and encountered nothing but wild and wild animals. So it is evident what Musa said to him when he met someone asking if he should answer "La misasa". Even though he never said the word "La misasa" but in practice his experience of adventuring in the desert was as if he himself had shouted the word so that no one dared to get close to him. Then Musa said parting words to him that he would meet a day that could not be avoided, namely the Day of Judgment, the day of retribution where he would receive a reward for his deeds commensurahte with the magnitude of the sins he had committed. Then Musa ordered Samiri to turn to the god he made and worshiped and said, "I will destroy this statue to dust and I will spread the dust into the sea so that it disappears without a trace."

In this verse, Moses says that the statue is not a god, their God is God Almighty. There is no god but Allah. He is the one who deserves to be worshiped and glorified, only to Him are all prayers and supplications offered, all creatures wish to Him because He is the Creator and Almighty. His knowledge is very broad, without limit covering everything, nothing escapes his knowledge, neither on earth, nor in the heavens nor in between, according to His word: Nothing is hidden from Him, even if it is as heavy as a particle, both in the heavens and in the sky. earth, which is smaller than that or larger, all (written) in a clear Book (Lauh Mahfudz)," (Saba'/34: 3)

In this verse, Allah explains to the Prophet Muhammad that the stories reported in the past verses, such as the story of Musa with Pharaoh and Samiri, as well as the stories of previous prophets, should serve as examples for him in dealing with his people who were very disobedient and disobedient. . Because that was indeed the situation of every apostle, even though books and miracles had been sent down to him to declare the truth of his preaching, his people still denied and tried their best to oppose his call and remained hostile and even wanted to kill him to eliminate him so that the voice of the truth he conveyed was no longer heard. As Allah sent down the Book of Zabur to the Prophet David as, Torah to Prophet Musa as and the Gospel to Prophet Isa as, Allah has sent down the Al-Qur'an to Muhammad, a Book that they deserve well because the teachings contained in it are for their benefit and happiness in this world and in the hereafter. Al-Qur'an is a complete holy book containing various guidelines regarding laws, social relations, economics, morals and so on. Besides that the Qur'an is the greatest miracle for the Prophet. No one can match the beauty of his language and the height of his literature. Therefore, let the Prophet be patient and never give up or be sad, keep fighting until victory is achieved and all evil disappears from the face of the earth, there is nothing worthy of worship except Allah, the One and the Almighty.

This will happen on the Day of Judgment, namely at the time of the second trumpet blowing as a sign for all humans to gather in Padang Mahsyar to receive an account of their deeds and efforts while he is still in the world. Good deeds will be rewarded with multiple rewards and bad deeds will be rewarded with appropriate retribution. On that day God gathered the sinners while their faces were pale and blue in color, because of the severity of the suffering they felt and the greatness and enormity of the atmosphere at that time, especially after thinking about the bad luck that had befallen them, why did they not want to accept the truth before? and still indulge the lust and will of satan.

They whispered to each other and asked each other in a barely audible voice because they were so afraid and worried. "We have only lived in this world for ten days? It is true that every person who has been hit by a severe calamity, imagines in his mind the twists and turns of his past life, everything has passed very quickly, as if the life he had enjoyed for decades happened in just a few moments.

In this verse Allah confirms that He knows everything they are discussing in whispers, when one of the most intelligent among them says that they live on earth only one day. Maybe it means just one day so that they will be released from the torment of their iniquity and from the retribution for their deeds because they only stay in this world for a short time, they are not given a longer chance to repent and do good deeds. But there is no point in talking about that anymore, because in fact they have been given a very wide opportunity during their life on earth to return to the truth, but they have not used this opportunity at all. In another verse Allah explains their condition, namely: And on the day (when) the Doomsday occurs, those who sin swear that they dwell (in their graves) only for a moment (only). (ar-Rum/30: 55) And His words: And (remember) on the day (when) Allah gathered them, (they felt) as if they had never lived (in the world) except for a moment during the day, (on time) they got to know each other. It is a loss for those who deny their meeting with Allah and they are not guided. (Yunus/10: 45)

In this verse, Allah explains in response to the question of the polytheists to Muhammad that the mountains on the Day of Judgment are crushed to pieces so that they fly in the air, like dust carried by the wind everywhere so that there is no trace at all. In an atmosphere of commotion and in a state of panic, they heard the voice of a caller, namely an angel who caught their attention entirely and without realizing it they submitted and obediently followed the order of the caller without thinking about the consequences of that order as stated in the word of Allah: By obeying them immediately come to the caller. (al-Qamar/54: 8) They are all called upon to appear before the presence of Allah, the Almighty and the Almighty, to receive an account of their deeds while living in this world. No one can avoid or free themselves from that calculation. At that time all creatures were silent, no sound was heard except for the whispers that occurred among themselves. No one dared to raise their voice because of the great atmosphere at that time, the atmosphere of facing God's presence to receive reckoning. Whoever believes and has good deeds, will certainly receive a double reward and will be admitted to heaven and whoever disbelieves and has many sins will receive a suitable reward and will be thrown into hell.

On that day, no one can help a person or give intercession to him either from angels or from humans except those who have been given permission by Allah that he will give intercession which is also acceptable to Allah according to the verse: And how many angels are in the sky , their intercession (help) is of no use unless Allah has permitted (and only) for whom He wills and is pleased with. (an-Najm/53: 26) Angels who are not sinful are not accepted for their intercession to help someone at that time unless Allah's permission let alone demons, idols or other polytheistic leaders, of course they cannot help in the least his followers. In this verse, Allah explains the reasons why intercession is useless without His permission. These reasons are because Allah knows all human actions, faith and unbelief, nothing is hidden from Him. He is actually the one who can determine whether a person is entitled to intercession, because of his faith and deeds while living in the world and He is also the one who has the right and can determine that a person cannot be interceded because of kufr and sins that cannot be forgiven. Meanwhile, angels or humans, even though they have been permitted by Him to intercede, do not know this in detail.

At that time, all faces bowed down feeling humble before Allah Almighty and Almighty Who will give the final decision regarding the fate of each of them according to their faith and deeds, a decision from the Most Just that cannot be disputed and must be implemented. Those who believe and do good deeds in preparation for this day of reckoning, they feel happy and grateful and imagine in their minds the reward that Allah will bestow upon them according to His promise, according to His justice and mercy. They are fully confident that they will not be wronged, will not be harmed in the slightest, they will be entered into Jannatun Na'im heaven in which there is endless pleasure and pleasure.

This verse explains that Allah sent down the Qur'an in Arabic so that it is easily understood by the polytheists of Mecca and so that they are interested in paying attention to its contents and the teachings contained therein. Thus they are expected to return to the truth and leave misleading beliefs such as worshiping misleading beliefs such as worshiping idols and can live peacefully and happily by carrying out the regulations contained in them because all the commands and prohibitions in them are merely -eyes for the good and happiness of humans in this world and in the hereafter. In the Qur'an, several warnings and threats are also given to disobedient people who do not want to pay attention to the calls of the prophets and messengers, and even reject them, because they are contrary to their desires, like the stories of earlier peoples. who have been destroyed because of their iniquities and information regarding the fate of disbelievers and sinners in the hereafter. It is narrated that the Prophet Muhammad saw when Jibril recited to him some of the verses that were revealed, he quickly re-read them even though Jibril had not finished reading all the verses that were to be conveyed to the Prophet. This was because the Prophet was afraid that if he did not quickly repeat it, he might forget and not be able to recall. Therefore Allah forbade him to act like that, because such an action might mess up his memorization even more because when he repeated reading what had been read to him his attention was focused on repeating the reading not on the next verses to be recited by Jibril even though Allah guaranteed that he would preserve Al-Qur'an as well as possible, so it is impossible for the Prophet Muhammad to forget or to be made by Allah to forget that he first listened carefully to all the verses that Jibril recited, then when Jibril finished reading them all, then the Prophet read them again. This verse emphasizes that Allah is the Most High, the Most Great, the Most Vast in Knowledge, with whose knowledge He regulates everything and makes rules according to the interests of His creatures, including regulations for the safety and happiness of mankind. It was he who sent the prophets and apostles and revealed holy books such as the Psalms, the Torah and the Bible and it was he who revealed the Qur'an to the Prophet Muhammad.
