(al-hijr/15: 9) Then Allah told the Prophet Muhammad to pray that He would give him additional knowledge. It was narrated by at-Tirmizi from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah prayed as follows: O Allah. Make the knowledge that You taught me useful for me, teach me the knowledge that is useful for me and give me additional knowledge. Praise be to Allah for everything, I seek refuge in Allah from the circumstances and everything that is done by the inhabitants of hell. (at-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah and al-Bazzar)

In this verse Allah has explained that He has instructed Adam to always be vigilant against Satan who is his enemy and the enemy of his wife Eve. Indeed, Satan has deceived him with his persuasion and told him that the khuldi (immortality) tree is the best tree, whoever eats from its fruit will surely remain in heaven forever. Because of his very desire that he will remain in heaven to enjoy God's unending gifts, Adam forgot about God's mandate and His prohibition not to eat this holy fruit. Adam forgot that Satan was his enemy who wanted to plunge him into the abyss of sin. Adam forgot that God forbade him to eat the forbidden fruit so he ate it. Here it appears that Adam, who already had knowledge of the Devil's bad intentions, could still be deceived by attractive promises made by the Devil to him, let alone an ordinary human being. no matter what, he must always remember and be vigilant and desperately defend his convictions and beliefs so that he cannot be tempted by Satan.

As a detailed explanation of how Adam was tricked by Satan into eating a fruit he was forbidden to eat. Allah explained the story from the beginning when He ordered the angels to bow down to Adam. Obediently and submissively, the angels prostrate to Him without arguing, without jealousy in their hearts, without feeling arrogant and arrogant, and not being the least bit reluctant to carry out their Lord's commands. Unlike the devil who is arrogant and arrogant, he is reluctant and does not want to bow down to Adam because he considers himself higher and more noble than Adam. Why should he bow down to Adam when Adam should be the one who bowed down to him. This is stated in the word of God: Then the angels all prostrated themselves. Except for the Devil; he is arrogant and he is among those who disbelieve. (Allah) said, "O Satan, what prevents you from bowing down to what I have created with My power. Are you arrogant or do you (feel) among the (more) high class?" (Satan) said, "I am better than him, because You created me from fire, while You created him from clay." (shad/38: 73-76)

Because Satan did not want to bow down to Adam because of his pride and jealousy of the glory and honor given to Adam. God confirmed to him that Satan was his enemy and his wife's enemy. Therefore he must be careful and aware of his behavior, never follow his flattery which may be in the form of advice or suggestions. There is no purpose except to inflict calamity or calamity on him. If he is deceived by his sweet mouth which if he follows it may cause Adam to be banished from heaven which is full of His grace and gifts. If this happened, of course the Devil would laugh happily while Adam would suffer a hard life on earth, where he had to fight and work hard for his survival while in heaven he lived a full life without lacking anything, all his wishes were easily achieved and done.

God promised Adam that while in heaven he would not feel hungry or thirsty because a variety of delicious foods, various drinks and fruits were always provided for him. He will never feel thirsty because a variety of delicious drinks are also provided for him and he will not be exposed to the hot sun because he is always in the shade with a cool breeze blowing. She will not be naked because Allah has given her very good and beautiful clothes. All that is liked and liked can be enjoyed in heaven as in His words: We are your protectors in the life of this world and the hereafter; in it (heaven) you get what you want and get what you ask for. As a tribute (to you) from (Allah) the Most Forgiving, the Most Merciful. (Fushshilat/41: 31-32) And His words: And in heaven there is what the heart desires and all that is pleasing to the eye. (az-Zukhruf/43: 71)

After Satan saw how happy Adam and his wife were in heaven enjoying various kinds of Divine grace, jealousy and envy arose in his heart and he really wanted the favors and gifts bestowed by Allah to be immediately removed from both of them. He saw that there was no more appropriate and powerful way to make that wish come true than to tempt the two of them to eat the forbidden fruit of khuldi. Thus surely Allah will be angry with Adam and expel him from heaven for disobeying His commands. Then the devil came to Adam pretending to be a loyal friend who always prioritized his goodness and happiness, and told him that the khuldi tree was a special tree, its fruit was very delicious, there are no fruits in heaven that are more delicious than khuldi . Whoever eats it will surely live forever and live in heaven forever. If Adam wanted to remain forever in this paradise then he must eat the fruit, surely he will live forever in a paradise that will not collapse forever.

This verse describes the condition of Adam and his wife Eve, when the Devil seduced them, without remembering God's mandate that the Devil was an enemy who wanted to harm him and Allah prohibited him from eating the forbidden fruit, Adam and Eve picked the fruit and immediately ate it with full hope that he would be with them. his wife will live eternally in heaven. Not long after Adam and Eve ate the forbidden fruit, their private parts were exposed, even though before eating the forbidden fruit, they did not pay the slightest attention to it, then they felt ashamed and quickly picked leaves in paradise to cover them. Some commentators argue that as a result of eating the fruit of khuldi, sexual urges (instincts) arose in Adam and Eve, because of that they felt ashamed to see each other's private parts. Thus, because he was driven by a very strong desire, Adam forgot about God's message until he disobeyed His commandment. He failed to face the test of his God, became weak in determination and will because of the temptations of Satan and because of the temptations of his own lust and desires so that he fell into the abyss of transgression.

After realizing that he and his wife had disobeyed God's commandment by eating the forbidden fruit, he regretted his delay, felt disappointed because he justified Satan's enticements and was deceived by the sweet words of his enemy. He was very worried about his fate with his wife because he had disobeyed his Lord. He felt sinful and asked forgiveness for his mistakes as mentioned in the verse: Both said, "O our Lord, we have wronged ourselves. If You do not forgive us and give mercy to us, surely we will be among the losers." (al-A'raf/7: 23)

God is Most Gracious, Most Merciful to His servants, especially to those who are appointed as caliphs on earth, therefore Allah will not repay Adam for eating the forbidden fruit by inflicting torture on him, in a state of forgetfulness so that he is deceived by the entreaties of his enemies, even though Adam had violated the prohibition of God who had ordered him not to be deceived by his enemy Satan, so that Adam was expelled from heaven. Adam and his wife were very sorry for what they had done and had repented and asked Him for forgiveness. Therefore Allah forgave his sins and chose him to be someone close to him. As a result of disobeying God's command, Adam was ordered out of heaven and down to earth, thus Allah's decree that Adam would be made the Caliph on earth was carried out, as stated in His words: "I want to make the caliph on earth." (al-Baqarah/2: 30)

Not only did Adam have to come down to earth but the enemy Satan who deceived him also had to come down to earth. These two types of creatures will be enemies for each other, the enmity of Satan towards humans is an eternal and continuous enmity until the Day of Judgment comes. The devil will always try to mislead people from the right path with all kinds of tricks. Therefore, God reminds Adam's children and grandchildren to always be aware of their main enemy. If instructions have come from God through His prophets and apostles, then humans should follow the instructions as taught by the apostles. Thus he will not go astray and will not be harmed. Ibn Abbas said regarding this verse that Allah protects those who follow the teachings of the Qur'an from going astray in this world and from accidents and calamities in the hereafter. From Ibn Abbas ra, Rasulullah said, "Who follows the book of Allah, Allah will guide him to avoid going astray in the world and keep him from the bad reckoning on the Day of Resurrection." (History of Ibn Abi Syaibah and ath-thabrani)

Allah explains that those who turn away from the teachings of the Qur'an do not heed them and oppose the instructions contained therein, as punishment they will always live in narrowness and difficulty. He will always be confused and anxious even though he has wealth, rank and position because he is always disturbed by thoughts and fantasies that are not true about his wealth and position. He will always be haunted by the specter of losing the pleasures he has achieved, so he commits acts that generate hatred and harm in his society. Then in the afterlife he will be gathered by Allah with other human beings in a state of blindness in his heart. Just as in this world he always rejects Allah's bright instructions and narrows his eyes so that these instructions are not seen by him so that he goes astray, so in the hereafter he cannot see any reason to defend himself against Allah's decree, the Most Just. Some commentators say that a person who turns away from Allah's teachings becomes blind to the five senses and does not see anything as an additional torment for him. A person who is blind at the time of commotion and catastrophe will be more confused because he does not know what to do and is unsure of the direction to go to save himself because he does not see where the threatening danger is coming from. But after that his eyes will brighten again because he saw his own charity record book and how great and terrible the torments of hell are as mentioned in the verse: And those who sinned saw hell, then they thought, that they would fall into it, and they could not find a place to turn from him. (al-Kahf/18: 53)

Those who disbelieve will ask God why you made me blind when my eyes were clear before. God answered, that it was so! Because in the world when the apostles came to him with His instructions he turned away from him as if his eyes had been blinded and as if he had forgotten him because he did not heed and pay attention to him. Therefore Allah makes the eyes of his heart blind on the Day of Judgment so that you cannot put forward an excuse to defend yourself from the punishment that has been prepared for him in return for their blindness while in the world.

Those who disbelieve will ask God why you made me blind when my eyes were clear before. God answered, that it was so! Because in the world when the apostles came to him with His instructions he turned away from him as if his eyes had been blinded and as if he had forgotten him because he did not heed and pay attention to him. Therefore Allah makes the eyes of his heart blind on the Day of Judgment so that you cannot put forward an excuse to defend yourself from the punishment that has been prepared for him in return for their blindness while in the world.

Thus Allah repays those who transgress and do not believe in the proofs of His power. In the world he encounters various difficulties, is always indecisive and restless, because there is nothing to hold on to in his life except wealth, rank and position. If he is struck by a difficulty or distress, he immediately panics and does not know what he is going to do, and sometimes without realizing it he does something that is detrimental to himself. He never felt peace and equanimity. This means he never felt true happiness. In the afterlife he will be tortured with various torments including heart torment because the eyes of his heart have become blind cannot provide reasons or proofs to free himself from Allah's punishment or he is indeed made completely blind so that he will be tormented even more because he is completely helpless to overcome the atmosphere of chaos and awesomeness. Indeed, the punishment in the hereafter is much more severe and terrible, especially the punishment in hell which is eternal forever.

In these verses, Allah calls the attention of the disbelievers so that they think calmly about how the past peoples ended, they were destroyed by Allah because of their disbelief by sending down various kinds of calamities, some in the form of hurricanes, terrible earthquakes and there were also in the form of a loud thundering sound. They could see with their own eyes the marks left by those people who had perished. The remains show that they were strong and victorious people in their time, had large and sturdy buildings, had a high culture, more than what the Meccan infidels had. But because of their disobedience and disobedience, they were destroyed by Allah in the twinkling of an eye, no one survived this catastrophe. What can be seen now are the ruins of the former palaces and their fortifications. The polytheists of Mecca on their trade trips in the summer and in the winter through the former kingdoms that had collapsed, but they never thought about why the kingdoms were destroyed and destroyed, and considered this to be the result of natural disasters. They should be able to take lessons from the previous peoples and realize that no matter how strong and mighty a people are, if Allah wills their destruction, because of rebellion and disbelief no one can defend or defend them. Why doesn't this all concern them. In fact, if they want to think, there are many lessons and proofs of God's power in those people who have been destroyed, but strangely they don't heed it.

Had it not been for Allah's mercy and compassion or for His decree that the rebellious Ummah of Muhammad would not be destroyed like those former nations, and the retribution for their disbelief was postponed until the Day of Judgment, they would surely have suffered destruction as well. This is stated in His word: In fact, the Day of Judgment is the day promised to them and the Day of Judgment is more terrible and more bitter. (al-Qamar/54: 46) Scholars say that the wisdom in suspending the torment of the ungodly followers of Muhammad until the Day of Judgment is to give them an opportunity to repent or to be among their descendants who believe. It is an honor and glory for the Prophet Muhammad and Allah's mercy and compassion for his people, thus the followers of his teachings will increase in number. This is in accordance with his expectations as mentioned in his words narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abi Hurairah: What was given to me was revelation revealed to me by Allah. So I hope that I will be the Prophet with the most followers among the Prophets. (History of ash-Shaikhan)

Then Allah ordered the Prophet Muhammad peace be upon him to remain patient with the actions of his disbelieving people and their ridicule and contempt for him such as accusing him of being a sorcerer, a madman, a poet and so on. In addition, he should always remember and purify God by glorifying and praying before sunrise, before sunset and at midnight. Indeed, by remembering Allah and by praying one can free himself from the confusion of thoughts, sadness and indecision. Prophet Muhammad himself once said about the benefits of prayer to reassure his heart. And make my heart calm when praying. (Ahmad and an-Nasai's history from al-Mugirah) In another verse, Allah commands that to deal with a complicated problem, we should be patient and establish prayer. And ask for help (of Allah) with patience and prayer. And (prayer) is really heavy, except for those who are solemn. (al-Baqarah/2: 45) In a hadith narrated by Ibn Jarir, the Messenger of Allah said: The Messenger of Allah said: "Surely you will see your Lord as you see this month, you are not hindered when you see Him. If you If you can try so that you don't miss your prayers before the sun rises and before it sets, then do it." (History of al-Bukhari and Muslim) Then the Prophet recited this verse 130. Narrated from Abu Hurairah. The Prophet Muhammad said, "Allah said, O son of Adam, use your time to worship Me, then I will fill your chest with wealth (inner) and remove your poverty. But if you don't want to do it, I will fill your chest with busyness and will not cover your poverty. ." (Ahmad and at-Tirmidhi's history) Then Allah said to the Prophet Muhammad saw that if you have done what I have commanded you, namely pray before sunrise, before sunset, and in the middle of the night, surely your soul will be peaceful and serene, and you will be pleased with what Allah has bestowed on you as stated in the verse: And indeed, your Lord will surely give His grace to you, so that you will be satisfied. (adh-dhuha/93: 5) Regarding this pleasure and inner satisfaction, an authentic hadith reveals the following: The Messenger of Allah said, "Allah said to the inhabitants of heaven, O inhabitants of heaven. They replied, We are ready to listen to your words O our Lord , safe and happy for You, then Allah says are you satisfied and satisfied? They replied: How can we not be pleased and satisfied You have bestowed upon us the favors that You do not give to other than us among Your creatures. So Allah said, I will grant you something better than that. They asked: What is this, O our Lord, which is better than the bounty we have received? Allah said, Allah said, I will give you My good pleasure, so I will not mad at you after that for all eternity." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Hurairah) This is the case if someone who has achieved the pleasure of Allah thanks to his obedience and obedience, to his Lord.

This verse explains that in order to strengthen the Prophet's heart and strengthen his stance in the face of the struggle to uphold the sentence of Allah, Allah instructed him that he should not divert his attention to the pleasures, luxuries and wealth enjoyed by some disbelievers because it will weaken his enthusiasm if his eyes are dazzled by the glare the jewels of the world and want to have what the rich have. All the blessings given to disbelievers are temporary, like a flower that is blooming, but soon the fragrant flower will wither and fall off its leaves one by one and all its beauty and allure will be lost. The enjoyment of wealth given to disbelievers is only temporary as a test for them, will they thank God with faith and use it to achieve His pleasure or will they remain disbelievers and sink further into error. so that the property becomes the cause of their own accident. Allah has bestowed upon the Prophet in exchange for outward favors better favors, namely peace of mind and happiness in the form of Divine pleasure. Narrated by Abu Rafi', a guest came to visit the Prophet, while there was nothing in his house that should be served to the guest. Rasulullah ordered me to borrow some wheat flour from the Jews and it will be paid later in the month of Rajab. The Jew would not lend unless it was guaranteed. I returned to the Prophet preaching it. The Messenger of Allah said: "By Allah, I am a person who can be trusted among the inhabitants of the heavens and a person who can be trusted among the inhabitants of the earth. If he lent or sold me, of course I paid for it. Bring this armor of mine. (History of al-Bazzar). Then this verse came down (thaha/20: 131).

This verse explains the next mandate which is no less important than the previous commandment, namely Allah's command to the Prophet to order his family to pray and be patient in carrying out prayers by keeping the time and its continuity. This order was accompanied by the second commandment, namely with a warning that Allah did not ask the Prophet for sustenance, instead Allah would provide sustenance for him, so that the Prophet did not have to think about the sustenance of his family. Therefore, his family should not be affected or be dazzled by the wealth and pleasures possessed by the wives of those who disbelieve. Such is the mandate of Allah to His Messenger as a provision to face a hard struggle, which should be an example for every fighter who wants to uphold the truth on earth. They must first establish a close relationship with their Creator, namely by continuing to pray and strengthening their minds with steadfastness and patience. In addition, the whole household must have the same characteristics as he has. Thus he will be steadfast in fighting not to be swayed by the adornments of worldly life such as wealth, rank and position. These mandates were practiced by the Prophet Muhammad and his companions so that they were truly successful in their struggle so that in a period of approximately 23 years, Islam had developed rapidly throughout the Arabian Peninsula and became the highest and most noble word of Allah. If the Apostle and his family faced various difficulties, he invited his family to pray, as narrated from the sickle, he said: When the Prophet's family is overwritten by trouble, he ordered them, "Come on, pray, pray," the sickle said, "The prophets if trouble befalls them immediately pray." (History of Ibn Abi Hatim)

The Meccan infidels ridiculed the Prophet Muhammad by saying that his appeal to the religion he brought was sheer nonsense. If the religion he brought was true, surely he would prove it with miracles such as that given to the Prophet Saleh, namely the she-camel, that which was given to the Prophet Musa like a staff and that which was given to Jesus, namely bringing the dead back to life and curing hair loss. If they had even a little bit of will to think and inclination to accept the truth they would not have uttered such words, because the Qur'an itself which was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad is his greatest miracle among the miracles given to the prophets before the Prophet Muhammad saw. Various evidences have shown that they cannot imitate the beauty of the arrangement of sentences and vocabulary of the Qur'an, nor can they come up with a single short surahh that is on a par with the surahhs in the Qur'an. Isn't it true that in the Qur'an there are stories about earlier peoples while the Prophet Muhammad himself did not know these stories before. Isn't it that in the Qur'an there are shari'ahs and regulations which have the same aims and objectives as the shariahs brought by the previous Prophets, namely shariahs for the benefit and happiness of mankind in this world and in the hereafter. Actually, the Al-Qur'an alone is enough proof for the truth of Muhammad saw and is enough as a great miracle that is eternal and eternal. Allah deeply regrets the attitude of those who reject the Qur'an just like that without a good reason and don't want to think about it even a little bit. In another verse, Allah also says: Actually, (the Qur'an) are clear verses in the hearts of those who have knowledge. Only those who are wrongdoers deny Our verses. And they (the disbelievers of Mecca) said, "Why aren't miracles sent down from their Lord?" Say (Muhammad), "The miracles are up to Allah. I am only a clear warner." Is it not sufficient for them that We have sent down to you the Book (the Qur'an) which is recited to them? Indeed, in that (Qur'an) there is a great mercy and a lesson for those who believe. (al-'Ankabut/29: 49-51)

This verse explains that if Allah had destroyed them before sending the Prophet Muhammad to them, they would have said on the Day of Judgment that Allah had not sent them a messenger whose teachings would be followed so that they would become believers before meeting this day of reckoning. Therefore Allah did not destroy them like the former nations so that there would be no excuse for them when facing the Day of Judgment on the Day of Judgment. Because Allah has sent them messengers who will explain to them the verses of Allah. Then it is up to them whether they will follow Allah's instructions or they will remain in disbelief and always insult and make fun of Muhammad peace be upon him.

In this verse, Allah ordered the Prophet Muhammad to speak to the Meccan infidels in response to their various excuses and ridicule against him. If they do not want to accept Allah's guidance and remain disobedient and disobedient, the Messenger of Allah will be with them waiting for Allah's decision on the Day of Judgment. Of course they will know who is on the right path and who is guided. They will know that they are the ones who are astray and will be thrown into the Hellfire. This is stated in the word of Allah: And later they will know when they see the doom, who is most astray in his ways. (al-Furqan/25: 42) And His words: Later they will know who is really a liar (and) arrogant. (al-Qamar/54: 26)
